intro: Marsdenia cavaleriei, commonly known as the Yunnan moonseed, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asclepiadaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and fleshy, ribbed stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels, and its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
